title: Is it possible to induce electric signals in the brain? - Quora

response.answer_text: you should define ‘distance’. In general yes, it is possible. Transcranial magnetic stimulation - Wikipedia Just know that even at relatively high intensities and with coils with the right geometry (H coil or double cone), you usually can’t stimulate structures deeper than 4–5 cm. If you’re thinking of brain hacking you’re maybe thinking of Transcranial direct-current stimulation - Wikipedia instead. It does not induce electrical signals in the brain in the same sense as TMS does, and it has not been proven to potentiate cognitive abilities, sadly

Yes. It's called thinking. You should try it. But in all seriousness, yes, people can electrically stimulate the brain, and no it isn't called brain hacking. It isn't really used to enhance (perfectly good) cognitive performance, so you're essentially wasting your time.
